msContents.summary: Receipt for 3,000 drachmas from the public bank at Oxyrhynchus made out to Aurelia Sintotoe also called Alitarion. The managers of the bank are named as Aurelius Ptolmion, exegete, and Aurelius Hereaklianos also called Morion chief priest

msItem.note: Written along the fibers; back blank
The hand is a fluent cursive
A space of 10 cm. is left blank beneath the text

div.ab: Aurelius Ptolemion exegete and Aurelius Herakleianos, also called Morion, chief priest, both senators of the distinguished and most distinguished city of Oxyrhynchos, managers [l. 5] of the public bank, greet Aurelia Sintotoe, also called Aleitarion. You have paid into the public bank of the nome for the reckoning of the month Choiak on behalf of . . . [l. 10] in the hamlet of Taotri . . . of the current 19th year and the 18th year the sum of three thousand silver drachmas, totals 3,000. The 19th and the 18th year [l. 15] of our Caesars Diocletian and Maximian, Augusti, and the 11th year of Constantine and Maximian, the most noble Caesars. Pauni 1(.).
